msgSnippet: Yeah, I know. But as I mentioned in previous message, if I have 20 testcase, the JUnit will invoke the setUp() function 20 times, and then call the each
messageBody:
Yeah, I know.
But as I mentioned in previous message, if I have 20 testcase, the JUnit will invoke the setUp() function
20 times, and then call the each testcase method. If my program runs in this way, it will cost too much resouce to run, so I need to run the testcase one by one.
With the help of Robert, I did in text mode this just now. :-)
But I lost the statistic information. What should I do next?

V.

主题: Re: ??,?: [junit] Run it one by one


> but where can I call these methods?


These methods are automatically called by the JUnit runner (TextUI or
SwingUI). You don't have to do anything for JUnit to invoke these methods.

> The way you say you need it to be done is how JUnit works.


it means that the problems are in your testcases and not in JUnit. Send
me PRIVATELY one of your testcase so I can have a look at it.

-Vladimir
